intro: Zabelia biflora f. insularis, commonly known as the island zabelia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific island habitats. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique floral morphology. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets surrounded by white ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal or maritime climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
